Plugin.Details: provides detections related to use of known-problematic avro APIs

Detector.Details: detects access to Schema.Field default value method(s)
detects direct instantiations of org.apache.avro.io.JsonDecoder via org.apache.avro.io.DecoderFactory
detects usage of incompatible schema/field props APIs

BugPattern.LongDescription: direct instantiations of org.apache.avro.io.BinaryDecoder, which is not directly accessible in modern avro
BugPattern.Details: org.apache.avro.io.BinaryDecoder's constructor was made package-private in modern avro org.apache.avro.io.DecoderFactory exists in avro 1.4+, but was not absolutely required under 1.4. for broadest compatibility (and ability to reuse existing custom decoders for new InputStreams) use com.linkedin.avroutil1.compatibility.AvroCompatibilityHelper.newBinaryDecoder()

BugPattern.LongDescription: direct instantiations of org.apache.avro.io.BinaryEncoder, which is abstract in modern avro
BugPattern.Details: org.apache.avro.io.BinaryEncoder was made abstract in modern avro, while org.apache.avro.io.EncoderFactory only exists in avro 1.5+. for broadest compatibility use com.linkedin.avroutil1.compatibility.AvroCompatibilityHelper.newBinaryEncoder()

BugPattern.LongDescription: any usage of org.apache.avro.message.BinaryMessageEncoder, which only exists in avro 1.8+
BugPattern.Details: org.apache.avro.message.BinaryMessageEncoder was introduced as part of avro 1.8, and so using it in code limits the compatibility of your codebase. As of this writing, we dont have a compatible alternative. Please file a ticket if you need one.

BugPattern.LongDescription: direct instantiations of org.apache.avro.generic.GenericData$EnumSymbol, which was incompatibly changed in avro 1.5
BugPattern.Details: org.apache.avro.generic.GenericData$EnumSymbol is constructed using only the string symbol before avro 1.5 but requires a Schema argument in 1.5+, as such there's no way to do this across all avro versions. use AvroCompatibilityHelper.newEnumSymbol()

BugPattern.LongDescription: access to org.apache.avro.Schema#Field.defaultValue(), which is an API that avro broke
BugPattern.Details: org.apache.avro.Schema#Field.defaultValue() returns a jackson 1 JsonNode in avro < 1.9. its been deprecated in 1.8 and replaced with defaultVal(), which returns a java wrapper or other object. in 1.9+ its been made package-protected and now returns jackson 2 JsonNodes

BugPattern.LongDescription: direct instantiations of org.apache.avro.generic.GenericData$Fixed, which was incompatibly changed in avro 1.5
BugPattern.Details: org.apache.avro.generic.GenericData$Fixed is constructed using only the byte[] contents before avro 1.5 but requires a Schema argument in 1.5+, as such there's no way to do this across all avro versions. use AvroCompatibilityHelper.newFixed()

BugPattern.LongDescription: usage of org.apache.avro.generic.GenericRecordBuilder, which only exists in avro 1.6+
BugPattern.Details: org.apache.avro.generic.GenericRecordBuilder was only added to avro in 1.6. As such using it renders your code incompatible with older avro and it's best avoided

BugPattern.LongDescription: starting with avro 1.7, specific records also implement GenericRecord
BugPattern.Details: starting with avro 1.7, specific records also implement org.apache.avro.generic.GenericRecord, making any "instanceof GenericRecord" checks always return true and completely meaningless. use AvroCompatibilityHelper.isGenericRecord() instead

BugPattern.LongDescription: direct instantiations of org.apache.avro.io.JsonDecoder, which is not directly accessible in modern avro
BugPattern.Details: org.apache.avro.io.JsonDecoder's constructors were made package-private in modern avro org.apache.avro.io.DecoderFactory exists in avro 1.4+, but was not absolutely required under 1.4. for broadest compatibility (and ability to parse both older and new json formats) use com.linkedin.avroutil1.compatibility.AvroCompatibilityHelper.newCompatibleJsonDecoder()

BugPattern.LongDescription: instantiations of org.apache.avro.io.JsonDecoder via DecoderFactory, which may not be compatible with old/new json format
BugPattern.Details: JsonDecoders built via org.apache.avro.io.DecoderFactory can only handle the json format used by the runtime avro version. avro has made a breaking change to its json format in 1.5+ and to be able to decode both formats its recommended to use the compatible json decoder available via AvroCompatibilityHelper.newCompatibleJsonDecoder()

BugPattern.LongDescription: direct instantiations of org.apache.avro.io.JsonEncoder, which is not directly accessible in modern avro
BugPattern.Details: org.apache.avro.io.JsonEncoder was made accessible only via org.apache.avro.io.EncoderFactory in avro 1.5+. for broadest compatibility use com.linkedin.avroutil1.compatibility.AvroCompatibilityHelper.newJsonEncoder()

org.apache.avro.specific.SpecificDatumReader$SchemaConstructable was renamed to org.apache.avro.specific.SpecificData$SchemaConstructable in avro >= 1.6 hence should not be directly referenced by portable code. see AvroCompatibilityHelper.newInstance()

BugPattern.LongDescription: usage of schema/field props APIs that are not compatible across avro versions
BugPattern.Details:
detects access to the following methods on Schema, Schema$Field and JsonProperties:

  • getJsonProp() - returns jackson1 JsonNode in avro 1.7.3, became private in 1.9 (and moved to jackson2)
  • getObjectProp() - in avro 1.8+
  • addProp(JsonNode) - uses jackson1 in avro 1.7.3, became private in 1.9 (and moved to jackson2)
  • addProp(Object) - in avro 1.8+
  • props() - avro 1.6 to 1.8
  • getJsonProps() - uses jackson1 in avro 1.7.3 to 1.8
  • getObjectProps() - in avro 1.8, became private in 1.9
  • addAllProps() - in avro 1.9+
NOTE: the getProp(Str) and addProp(Str) methods exist in all avro versions (hence are compatible), but only operate on string props

BugPattern.LongDescription: direct instantiation of org.apache.avro.Schema$Field, which there is no way of compatibly doing across avro versions
BugPattern.Details: org.apache.avro.Schema$Field has switched from using jackson1 to using Object literals for default values (as part of avro moving to jackson2 internally) starting with 1.9. this completely changed all constructor signatures. use AvroCompatibilityHelper.createSchemaField() instead.
org.apache.avro.specific.SpecificData.newInstance() will not honor "old" SchemaConstructable classes under avro < 1.6. see AvroCompatibilityHelper.newInstance()
